intro: Boechera lignifera, commonly known as the hardstem rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, with a hairy texture. Boechera lignifera is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants.
